title: Is Fitbit a dying company? - Quora

response.answer_text: I do not think Fitbit is a dying company. It has over $500 million in the bank and that is a lot of capital to innovate with. Fitbit is executing multiple multi-year transitions that will take time, but are already proving correct. Fitbit is transitioning its core product from industry-leading activity trackers to fitness-focused smartwatches. Fitbit recently announced it sold over a million Versa smartwatches and it was the fastest selling product in its history. [1]Fitbit is diversifying its revenue source from single hardware purchases to recurring revenue from accessory services, like its premium workout app.[2]Fitbit is diversifying its retail channels by trying to increase sales through health insurance and corporate health programs.Footnotes[1] https://investor.fitbit.com/press/press-releases/press-release-details/2018/Fitbit-Ships-More-than-One-Million-Fitbit-Versa-Devices-Over-Two-Million-Use-Female-Health-Tracking-Within-First-Month/default.aspx[2] Fitbit's Multi-Year Transformation Will Test Investors' Patience
